applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of a specific pension scheme, not an intermediary disclosure document. 2) The document shows this is a direct product from AIB Life (Saol Assurance d.a.c.) rather than an intermediary service. 3) The document does not contain any content about market analysis or product producer selection, which would be required if it fell under this regulation. 4) The document is focused on defining the rules, benefits, and trustee responsibilities for a specific pension scheme rather than addressing intermediary services or market comparisons. The regulation specifically targets intermediaries who need to disclose which product producers they consider, which is not relevant to this type of scheme rules document.
regulation_title: Intermediaries which do not provide financial services on the basis of a fair analysis of the market
regulation_text: 57. Where an intermediary does not provide a financial service on the basis of a fair analysis of the market, it shall clearly disclose to the consumer the names of those product producers whose financial services it intends to consider as part of its analysis .
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
